result.value:
* Belić, J.; van Beek, B.; Menzel, J. P.; Buda, F.; Visscher, L. `Systematic Computational Design and Optimization of Light Absorbing Dyes <https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jpca.0c04506>`__. *J. Phys. Chem. A* **2020**, *124* (31), 6380–6388.
* van Beek, B.; Zito, J.; Visscher, L.; Infante, I. CAT: A Compound Attachment Tool for the construction of composite chemical compounds. *J. Chem. Inf. Model.* (submitted).

.. _yaml: https://yaml.org/
.. _documentation: https://cat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
.. _miniconda: http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html
.. _anaconda: https://www.continuum.io/downloads
.. _installConda: https://docs.anaconda.com/anaconda/install/
.. _HDF5: http://www.h5py.org/
.. _here: https://www.python.org/downloads/
.. _rdkit: http://www.rdkit.org
.. _PLAMS: https://github.com/SCM-NV/PLAMS
.. _QMFlows: https://github.com/SCM-NV/qmflows
.. _example1: https://github.com/BvB93/CAT/blob/master/examples/input_settings.yaml
.. _example2: https://github.com/BvB93/CAT/blob/master/examples/input.py
A collection of tools designed for the automatic construction, and subsequent analysis, of chemical compounds.

**CAT** is a collection of tools designed for the construction of various chemical compounds.
Further information is provided in the documentation_.

An extensive description of the various available settings is available in
the documentation_.

**CAT** can be installed via pip as following:

- **CAT**: ``pip install nlesc-CAT --upgrade``

Note that, while not strictly necessary, it is recommended to first create a conda environment:

- Download and install miniconda for python3: miniconda_ (also you can install the complete anaconda_ version).

- Create a new virtual environment:  ``conda create --name CAT python``

- Activate the environment:: ``conda activate CAT``

.. image:: https://readthedocs.org/projects/cat/badge/?version=latest
   :target: https://cat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
.. image:: https://zenodo.org/badge/169708827.svg
   :target: https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/169708827
.. image:: https://badge.fury.io/py/nlesc-CAT.svg
   :target: https://badge.fury.io/py/nlesc-CAT 
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.6-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.6/
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.7-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.7/
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.8-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.8/
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.9-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.9/
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.10-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.10/
.. image:: https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.11-blue.svg
   :target: https://docs.python.org/3.11/

Running **CAT** and can be done with the following command:
``init_cat my_settings.yaml``. The user merely has to provide a yaml_ file
with the job settings, settings which can be tweaked and altered to suit ones
purposes (see example1_). Alternatively, **CAT** can be run like a regular
python script, bypassing the command-line interface
(*i.e.* ``python input.py``, see example2_).

Running **CAT** and can be done with the following command:
``init_cat my_settings.yaml``. The user merely has to provide a yaml_ file
with the job settings, settings which can be tweaked and altered to suit ones
purposes (see example1_). Alternatively, **CAT** can be run like a regular
python script, bypassing the command-line interface
(*i.e.* ``python input.py``, see example2_).
automation, chemistry, molecular-mechanics, python, quantum-mechanics, science, scientific-workflows

The Compound Attachment/Analysis Tool (CAT) is an Open Source project supported by the VU University Amsterdam, the Netherlands eScience Center (NLeSC) 
and Scientific Computing & Modelling NV (SCM). The terms of the [LGPL-3.0 license]* apply. As an exception to the LGPL-3.0 license, 
you agree to grant SCM a [BSD 3-Clause license]** to the contributions you commit on this Github or provide to SCM in another manner.

result.description:
## What's Changed
* ENH: Add support for polyatomic core anchors by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/259
* BLD: Bump the minimum QMFlows version to 0.12.0 by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/260


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/1.0.0...1.1.0
result.name: CAT 1.1.0

result.description:
## What's Changed
* REL: Bump CAT to 1.0.0 by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/257


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.11.1...1.0.0
result.name: CAT 1.0.0

result.description:
## What's Changed
* ENH: Lay the groundwork fork for the Nano-CAT ligand branching workflow by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/256


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.11.0...0.11.1
result.name: CAT 0.11.1

result.description:
## What's Changed
* ENH: Add the `remove_anchor_hydrogens` option to the cone-angle workflow by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/240
* ENH: Minor improvements to computing the ligand conformer optimization cost function by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/241
* TST: Re-enable windows tests by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/242
* TST,ENH: Add a function for checking if the coordinates of two molecules are equal within a given tolerance by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/243
* TST: Let `assert_mol_allclose` check for both bonds and lattices as well as atomic coordinates by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/244
* ENH: Improve the ligand conformation search by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/246
* BUG: Fix the CAT logger failing to write to stdout by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/247
* ENH: Set the default Indium (formal) charge to 3+ by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/248
* BUG: Fix the ligand conformation optimizer failing for certain cyclic systems by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/249
* BUG: Only disable the rdkit `SANITIZE_ADJUSTHS` when strictly required by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/250
* BUG: Fix the `anchor.kind = "mean"` keyword being broken by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/252
* REL: Prepare for CAT 0.11.0 release by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/254


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.6...0.11.0
result.name: CAT 0.11.0

result.description:
## What's Changed
* ENH: Allow multiple values for the bulkiness latice spacing by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/233
* BUG: FIx an issue wherein optimized geometries were not correctly written to the .hdf5 file by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/234
* BUG: Ensure that the ligand is properly aligned after PLAMS optimizations by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/235
* ENH: When optimizing ligand conformations, fully relax the geometry before computing the cost function by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/237
* ENH: Improve the optimized geometries of linear ligands by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/238
* ENH: Add a new workflow for computing ligand cone angles by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/239


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.5...0.10.6
result.name: CAT 0.10.6

result.description:
## What's Changed
* BUG: Fixed an issue where certain properties could not be extracted from CP2K frequency jobs by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/231
* ENH: Add the `anchor.multi_anchor_filter` option by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/232


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.4...0.10.5
result.name: CAT 0.10.5

result.description:
## What's Changed
* REL: Update `master` branch after CAT 0.10.3 release by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/228
* BUG: Fix thermochemical properties not properly being set to `nan` for crashed jobs by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/229
* ENH: Add the ``qd.dissociate.qd_opt`` keyword by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/230


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.3...0.10.4
result.name: CAT 0.10.4

result.description:
## What's Changed
* REL: Update `master` branch after 0.10.2 release by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/223
* ENH: Allow `core.allignment: "surface"` for cores with <4 anchor atoms by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/224
* ENH: Allow the BDE workflow to parse qmflows-style generic keywords by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/225
* BUG: Fix the BDE `core_atom` and `lig_count` keys not being optional by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/226
* ENH: Expose a keyword for the BDE XYn-preoptimization by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/227


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.2...0.10.3
result.name: CAT 0.10.3

result.description:
## What's Changed
* REL: Update master branch after release (0.10.1)  by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/214
* ENH: Allow specifying dummy atoms as anchor group by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/215
* ENH: Allow specifying the format type of the anchor `group` by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/216
* TST: Add a mypy run to the linting checks by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/217
* BUG: Disable the `PNG` and `PNG_FILE` anchor format options for RDKit <2020.09.01 by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/218
* BUG: Fix an issue wherein anchor-group-parsing could fail for mono-atomic anchors by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/219
* BLD: Add minimum versions to more packages by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/220
* BLD: Allow installing `CAT` without the use of conda by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/221
* REL: Prepare for CAT 0.10.2 by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/222


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.1...0.10.2
result.name: CAT 0.10.2

result.description:
## What's Changed
* TST: Move test dependencies to pypi by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/201
* ENH: Add the `angle_offset` option for manually rotating ligand vectors by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/202
* ENH: Allow specification of a fixed ligand-vector dihedral angle by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/204
* TST: Improve the test coverage for the anchor input parsing by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/205
* TST: Update coordinates for RDKit 2021.03.4  by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/206
* MAINT: Do not modify global logging settings when configuring the CAT logger by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/207
* ENH,WIP: Add an option for inverting the core vectors by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/208
* ENH: Bring the core anchoring options up to par with its ligand-based counterpart by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/211
* MAINT: Backport the PLAMS <= 1.5.1 `Molecule.get_formula` method by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/212
* TST: Add a dedicated CI job for pre-releases by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/209
* DOC: Do not use conda when building RTD docs by @BvB93 in https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/pull/213


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/compare/0.10.0...0.10.1
result.name: CAT 0.10.1

result.description:
* Add more advanced anchor-parsing options.
* Update for AMS 2021.
* Fixed various issues.
result.name: CAT 0.10.0

result.description:
See https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/milestone/6:
* Added the new ``optional.core.anchor`` and ``optional.ligand.functional_groups`` options, 
  which are respectively aliases for the old ``optional.core.dummy`` and ``optional.ligand.functional_groups`` options.
* Added a new H3O+ .coskf file.
* Added a new template for LogP calculations.
* Enabled tests for Windows.
* Fixed a recent readthedocs failure.
* Improve the conformations of ringed systems; ring-substituents are now treated as fragments.
* For some reason the matplotlib logger is going bananas; its level has been changed from DEBUG (default) to INFO in order to silence it.
result.name: CAT 0.9.10

result.description:
See https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/milestone/4:
* Update the documentation for https://github.com/nlesc-nano/data-CAT/pull/38.
* Relax the pandas version requirement.
result.name: CAT 0.9.7

result.description:
See https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/milestone/3:
* Various [Data-CAT](https://github.com/nlesc-nano/data-CAT) related documentation updates.
result.name: CAT 0.9.6

result.description:
See https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/milestone/2:
* Fixed a bug where rdkit molecules were not properly converted into numpy arrays.
* Only perform `optional.ligand.optimize.job2` if the preceding UFF optimization finishes without crashing.
* Remove a ligand if its optimization fails (_i.e._ an exception is raised).
* Fixed an issue where ligand anchoring groups could not be explicitly specified
  [docs](https://cat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/3_input_core_ligand.html#indices)).
* Improved the conformations of ligands with tri- and penta-valent pnictogen anchors.
result.name: CAT 0.9.5

result.description:
* Fixed an issue where certain `AMSJobs` would have duplicate keys.
* Fixed an issue where certain ligands weren't exported when constructing multi-ligand quantum dots (see https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/issues/115).
* Re-enabled tests for Python 3.6 (see https://github.com/nlesc-nano/CAT/issues/125).
result.name: CAT 0.9.4

result.description:
* Switched from travis to GitHub Actions.
* Added tests using flake8, pydocstyle and doctest.
result.name: CAT 0.9.3

result.description:
* Updated the Data-CAT documentation (see https://github.com/nlesc-nano/data-CAT/pull/23).
* Upped the minimum Sphinx version to 2.1.
* Removed ``sphinx-autodoc-typehints``.
* Removed ``requirements.txt`` in favor of ``.readthedocs.yml``.
result.name: CAT 0.9.2

result.description: * Added a new conceptual DFT (CDFT) workflow to Nano-CAT (https://github.com/nlesc-nano/nano-CAT/pull/57).
result.name: CAT 0.9.1

result.description: * Moved a number of functions to the [nanoutils](https://github.com/nlesc-nano/Nano-Utils) package.
result.name: CAT 0.9.0

result.description: * Added the option to perform ligand geometry optimizations at arbitrary levels of theory.
result.name: CAT 0.8.9

result.description:
* Fixed a bug where ligands weren't properly rotated when using ``optional.ligand.optimize = False``.
* Added tests for ``CAT.utils.SetAttr``.
result.name: CAT 0.8.8

result.description:
* Replaced ``print()`` calls with ``logger.warning()`` in all dye-related functions.
* Added a recipe for calculating the synthetic accessibility score (SAS) as adapted from [MolGAN](https://github.com/nicola-decao/MolGAN).
result.name: CAT 0.8.7

result.description:
* Bumped the version to 0.8.5.
* Added documentation for the new Nano-CAT ``multi_ligand_job()`` recipe (https://github.com/nlesc-nano/nano-CAT/pull/48).
result.name: CAT 0.8.6

result.description: * Turned the ``dye`` functionality into a recipe in ``CAT.recipes``.
result.name: CAT 0.8.4.1
